intro: Phyllorkis striata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed rockheath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered white or pink flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Phyllorkis striata is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and adaptability to harsh environments.
